TopicTitle: Which feature of KSP 2 attracts you the most?

Articles.Content:
Which feature of KSP 2 attracts you the most? As in, I might spend more time on KSP 2 by cutting time out of KSP 1?

Also, no, I am not from the marketing department of Star Theory, nor from Squad.

Edited January 26, 2020 by Xd the great

4 hours ago, Xd the great said:

Which feature of KSP 2 attracts you the most? As in, I might spend more time on KSP 2 by cutting time out of KSP 1?

Also, no, I am not from the marketing department of Star Theory, nor from Squad.

might help if you establish a maximum picks

cant imagine many not filling out the 1st 5

I checked everything except multiplayer, even though I am pleased to see it added and I think it is a great thing to have included I doubt I will use it much myself.

I am just looking forward to KSP2 in general for the overall improvements it seems to offer, from what little we have seen so far.  There aren't any particular features that stand out for me.

The closest to mine is "New Planets/Solar Systems" so I picked that.

But what I'm really most jazzed about is axial tilt and the potential to easily modify systems without the need for mods.

I'm hoping we can edit planetary systems in KSP2 as easily as we can edit parts in KSP1.
Considering I just walked Valentina up a mountain using time warp and "crashed" her into the ground 4 times on the way up, I'd say the stable physics engine will be the biggest! XD
new kerbal emotes, HA hA haW HE HOOO
None; because the game isn't actually out yet and i don't know if these "features" will actually be there or fleshed out enough.
New engines. Orion drive? OoOooOoO Nuke powered engine? I’d love to see that try to destroy the KSC! And much, much more...
Orion drives. Nuff said.

I don't know why people aren't as excited about multiplayer as new star systems, which can be added with mods in KSP 1 with relative ease. This is huge, we can build colonies or send huge fleets of ships to other planets and star systems together! That is something KSP 1 could have never (and most likely will never) achieve.

I'm with you bro, factorio is single player oriented but playing in servers with a group is fun because you see the rapid progression as well as dicking round and being stupid en mass. Also sharing blueprints and learning other quirks people have found really helps refine each other's abilities in the game. Also, running a space program solo gets exhausting after a certain amount of infrastructure is built and having helping hands would be really useful. 

 

And then there's the game evolution possibilities... Bd armory servers in this game will be its own unique experience. Dogfights testing not only piloting but engineering skills as well? Omg yes. Space race with launching attacks at one another with nukes from different side of kerbin or even different planets?! Dear God let it happen.

More content (covers 4/7 poll options): Meh, add it (or mod it) in later.
Better graphics: I still play DooM (1). Graphics are overrated.
Multiplayer: Maybe. I probably won't use it though.

You know what I do want from KSP2? I want a game engine that allows me to build moderately large craft without slowing to a crawl, add a handful of mods without immersion eviscerating garbage collection freezes, and interact with planetary surfaces without encountering ragequit-inducing physics jank.

This. Thank you steve_v for once more spelling out my thoughts.

The thing I want the most is a game loop with more things to do. After thousands of hours I'm a bit bored with KSP 1, and I seem to be the kind of person who can't just set themselves a goal and achieve it -- I need the game to give me REASON to, idk, to build a certain type of space station, or land on a hard to reach planet. 

That's not to say KSP 1 is bad, far from it! I love that game to bits, it just feels like I've kinda played it to the end.

6 hours ago, steve_v said:

You know what I do want from KSP2? I want a game engine that allows me to build moderately large craft without slowing to a crawl, add a handful of mods without immersion eviscerating garbage collection freezes, and interact with planetary surfaces without encountering ragequit-inducing physics jank.

QFT.  My vote is pretty much summed up in the above.

But I would go a step further and say that part-count and craft size should have no noticeable impact on performance. 10 parts, or 1000 parts, should perform the same.  That is what I want out of an updated engine.

(Being a developer, and knowing a few things about physics sim coding, I fully realize that what I desire is technically impossible; any added complexity -will- impact performance; the KSP2 dev's duty, is to ensure that this impact threshold is below that which would be noticeable, by actually optimizing for that goal, rather then just using 'whatever Unity provides')
